title: Sooji Potato Pancakes Recipe, Finger Food Recipes for Toddlers and Babies
content:
This is one recipe that I came up with when I wanted to feed my little one with some snacks in the evening. I had a boiled potato on hand, so I added some sooji and made it into the pancake. It turned out so soft, so it will be easy for your little one to chew. Plus it is so tasty.

 

Preparation Time; 10 mins

Cooking Time: 1 to 2 mins per batch

Makes: 10 mini pancakes

 

Ingredients:

Potato – 1 boiled, peeled and mashed

Sooji / Rava / Semolina – 1 cup

Water – 1/2 cup or as needed

Salt to taste

Spring Onions – 3 tablespoons finely chopped

Carrots or Beetroots – 1/4 cup grated

Ghee or Oil for making pancakes

 

Method:

Take mashed potatoes in a bowl, add water, sooji, salt, and mix well. Add in carrots and spring onions. Mix well., Set this batter aside for 10 mins.

Heat oil or ghee in a non-stick pan and make mini pancakes.

Cook for a few minutes on one side., flip over and cook on another side.

Remove to a plate and serve

recommendations.content: Sweet Potatoes are such wholesome food to give for babies. It has so many health benefits, read all of them here. recommendations.title: Beetroot milk Recipe, Rose milk using Beetroots
recommendations.content:
Delicious rose milk made using beetroots. This is healthy for kids and toddlers. Instead of giving normal rose milk with lots of food coloring, you can give this beet milk.
